title: 91/551/EEC: Commission Decision of 27 September 1991 calling upon the Kingdom of Spain to postpone the adoption of a draft regulation in respect of the labelling of confectionery containing polyalcohols (Only the Spanish text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 27  September 1991 calling upon the Kingdom of Spain to postpone the adoption of a draft regulation in  respect of the labelling of confectionery containing polyalcohols (Only the Spanish text is  authentic) (91/551/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1.  The Kingdom of Spain shall, for a period of 12 months from the  notification of this Decision, postpone the adoption of its draft regulation in respect of the  measures requiring certain warnings to be given on the labelling of sweets, chewing gum and other  types of confectionery containing polyalcohols.
2.  Any national regulation adopted by the Kingdom of Spain after the abovementioned 12 month  period and in the absence of relevant Community provisions may not ban the use of the EEC number to  designate polyalcohols in the list of ingredients of products containing that category of  additives.
This Decision is addressed to the Kingdom of Spain.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 27 September 1991.
For the Commission Martin BANGEMANN Vice-President
